function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of induction units and fan coils with local circulation may lead to the resuspension of virus particles.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient outdoor airflow can contribute to the buildup of infectious contaminants in indoor spaces.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misconceptions about the effectiveness of hepa filters in capturing coronaviruses","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited use of hepa filters in non-healthcare occupational settings","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to use proper ppe","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper fit or seal of respirators","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on outdated guidelines for controlling covid-19 transmission in workplaces.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of surface hygiene and cleaning protocols","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Text mentions the spread of contagious diseases in built environments at all scales.","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious transmission of coronavirus from animal to human","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High occupant density facilitates the accrual of human-associated microorganisms","category":"Lack of effective medical solutions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased exposure risk associated with high occupant density and consistent contact demonstrated in covid-19 outbreaks","category":"Lack of effective medical solutions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transfer of viruses from individuals to surfaces and vice versa through contact","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survival of sars-cov-2 on different surfaces, indicating potential for fomite transmission","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of sars-cov-2 through fecal-oral pathway","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possibility of sars-cov-2 transmission through aerosols","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper handwashing and hygiene practices","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close contact and spatial proximity with infected persons","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The spread of sars-cov-2 through aerosolized water droplets from sink areas","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective handwashing and hand sanitizing protocols","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to uvc light can pose safety concerns for room occupants if not properly installed or used.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uvc and uvgi light disinfectant strategies for buildings may have unintended consequences if not implemented with appropriate precaution.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cohousing patients with vastly different requirements","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential migration of aerosols from patient rooms into higher traffic corridors, increasing the risk of spreading airborne pathogens.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of sars-cov-2 virus through droplets and fomites","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne spread of sars-cov-2 virus during aerosol-generating procedures","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertain role of the faecal-oral route in sars-cov-2 transmission","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of bioaerosol samplers in a hospital environment can lead to potential aerosolized pathogen exposure.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High number of positive air and surface samples indicating potential contamination","category":"Lack of effective medical solutions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive samples from isolation rooms indicate potential spread of the virus to other areas","category":"Lack of effective medical solutions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Toilet identified as the most contaminated environment","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of viral particles in bathroom surfaces and aerosols","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of hands during toilet usage","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Generation of bio-aerosols in drainage stacks after toilet flushing","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination and spread of viruses in the toilet area due to shared use by multiple patients, potentially leading to a higher risk of infection.","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transfer rate of viruses from smooth to rough surfaces may contribute to contamination in the toilet area.","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of positive samples in the toilet area and potential presence of sars-cov-2 in patient stool samples present an increased risk of viral spread in the built environment.","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for transmission of covid-19 in the process of real-world evidence research","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in sharing clinical trial data during a global pandemic","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low percentage of trials published and results available","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate data collection and efforts may lead to ineffective management of contagious diseases.","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases to other individuals due to interaction with contributors","category":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with public health measures","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in implementing adequate controlling measures","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Age and marital status as predictors of hiv infection","category":"Lack of access to health
